cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi (210 km) south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the northwestern Caribbean, through the Yucatán Channel and then north-northwest toward the central/northern Gulf of Mexico with Louisiana in the middle of the forecast cone

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Artemisa and the Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Alabama (Louisiana coast centered in cone)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) increasingly likely late Thursday; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out at landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft storm surge along the Plaquemines Parish coast and Lower Mississippi River delta accompanied by large waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands capable of 4–8 in totals near and east of the track, producing flash-flood potential at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands Thursday-Friday.
